page.title: 16A HEDGE IN ELMSTEAD.
page.content: Allens Farm has lots of{hedges. } In two 30 metre stretches we found many different bushes and trees. In the first stretch we found{oak, } {hawthorn}and{buckthorn.}In the second stretch of{30 metres}we found that there were more{ash,beech}and {buckthorn}than{elder}and{hazel.}The first hedge is probably 300 years old and the second hedge 500 years old because each species is worth approximately 100 years. There were a lot of{nettles}and other plants at the bottom of the hedge such as{foxglove, {ferns, hogweed, black bryony,dog rose, {white campion}and{honey suckle.}At Allens Farm there are some{beehives, a{moorhen}on the pond and some {partridges.}Allens Farm dates back to {1584}.There was probably a building before Allens Farm because it was mentioned in the first{Domesday Book.
